info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 7:05PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Catawba, southern Alexander, Iredell, southeastern Caldwell and western Rowan Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 705 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Newton, or near Catawba, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hickory, Statesville, Newton, Mooresville, St. Stephens, Conover, Longview, Bethlehem, Troutman and Stony Point. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
